page.title: 19GRANDADS' MEMORIES.
page.content: WE INTERVIEWED{2 GRANDADS,}ASKING THEM ABOUT THE WAR AND THINGS THEY REMEMBERED FROM{50 YEARS AGO.}THEY SAID FARM MACHINERY HAS CHANGED, THEY USED HORSES TO DRAW CARTS AND TO PLOUGH. HOUSES HAVE CHANGED A GREAT DEAL SINCE THE WAR, BRICKS ARE USED MUCH MORE NOW, UP TO THE WAR HOUSES WERE MADE OF{LOCAL FLINT.}FOOD IS VERY DIFFERENT FROM THE FOOD THEY USED TO EAT. CARS WERE VERY RARE, BUT A LOT STRONGER THAN THEY ARE NOW. THEY COULD REMEMBER LORRIES, MADE FROM STEEL, AND BIKES, WHICH WERE VERY HEAVY. THEIR TEACHERS WERE VERY STRICT AND USED THE CANE BUT THEY ENJOYED PLAYING CRICKET, FOOTBALL AND ROUNDERS, AND AT PLAYTIME THEY WOULD PLAY WITH{SPINNING TOPS, {MARBLES AND HOOPS.}THE DISUSED RAILWAY CUTTING RUNS PAST OUR SCHOOL AND THE GRANDADS COULD REMEMBER WHEN THE TRAINS RAN ALONG IT.
